greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The smallest positive noncomposite q such that 2n-1 = 2p+q for some positive noncomposite p.
comment: It is a Goldbach conjecture variant that terms exist for 2n-1 >= 5.
Lemma: N=2n-1 is coprime to q=a(n) unless N=3q. Proof: Suppose N and q are not coprime; so we have N=2p+q=iq with i=/=1=/=q, so (i-1)q=2p; now since q=/=2 (because N is odd), then q=p and i=3. QED.
reference: Emile Lemoine, L'intermédiaire des mathématiciens, 1 (1894), 179; ibid 3 (1896), 151.
link: Jason Kimberley, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10002 (corrected by Michel Marcus, Jan 19 2019)
Brian H. Mayoh, On the second Goldbach conjecture, BIT Numerical Mathematics 6 (1966) 1, 48-50
Index entries for sequences related to Goldbach conjecture
program: (MAGMA) A185091 := func<n|exists(q){q:q in[1..N div 3 by 2]|(q eq 1 or IsPrime(q))and IsPrime((N-q)div 2)}select q else -1 where N is 2*n-1>;[A185091(n):n in [3..94]];
xref: Records in this sequence are in A002092 occurring at 2n-1 in A002091.
results.author: _Jason Kimberley_ (with thanks to _Hugo Pfoertner_), Sep 05 2011
